p: Alkaloids are major constituent of Zanthoxylum due to which it showed different pharmacological activities ( Negi et al., 2011). Alkaloids are the important constituent of this genus which includes quinolines, isoquinolines, and amide alkaloids due to which it showed various pharmacological activities including anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antioxidant ( Souto et al., 2011). Three new alkaloids zanthocadinanine, 7-methoxy-8-demethoxynitidine and zanthonitiside are obtained from genus Zanthoxylum which is used for the treatment of numerous ailments such as fever, gingivitis, and toothache. Several classes of alkaloid are responsible for anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties ( Adebayo et al., 2015). The alkaloid obtained from the medicinal plant is responsible for the analgesic activity. The analgesic activity of alkaloids inhibits pain via opioid receptors in the CNS ( Asante et al., 2019).
